channel.title: I get an error when I try to use this client
channel.description:
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:276) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Anyone know how I can fix this...

item.title: I get an error when I try to use this client
item.dc:creator: @I_can_3_hit I can 3 hit
item.description:
@I_can_3_hit wrote:

It cant be a bad file since my friend can use it

But thanks anyway[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2008, 12:56:31 AM[/size][hr]Anybody know how to fix this?

item.title: I get an error when I try to use this client
item.dc:creator: @ChrisDaden ChrisDaden
item.description:
@ChrisDaden wrote:

Ok, If your EGUI is only a class file, and doesnt ahve the JAVA source file, The only other thing I can say is its a bad file?

Hopefully someone else can help you if i am incorrect.

Sorry:

–Chris

@I_can_3_hit wrote:

I compiled still doesn’t work.

Heres what the compiler says just if you wanna know.

Note: Frame_Sub1.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Server Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

EDIT:
My EGUI Is only a class file not java

I dont know anything about clients so yea…

item.source: I get an error when I try to use this client

item.title: I get an error when I try to use this client
item.dc:creator: @ChrisDaden ChrisDaden
item.description:
@ChrisDaden wrote:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI

All you really need to do is read the error, it tells you exactly:

NoClassDefFoundError

Meaning No class found.

You can fix this by compiling (If you have the EGUI.java file) and it will create the class.

If this doesn’t fix it, please reply here.

–Chris

P.S please remember that this is one of MANY different problems it could be.

Read full topic
